solution_line_template: The {num_spam_cans} cans of Spam costs ${spam_price_per_can} x {num_spam_cans} = $<<{spam_price_per_can}*{num_spam_cans}={cost_spam}>>{cost_spam}.
The total amount of {num_pb_jars} jars of peanut butter is ${pb_price_per_jar} x {num_pb_jars} = $<<{pb_price_per_jar}*{num_pb_jars}={cost_peanut_butter}>>{cost_peanut_butter}.
And the total amount of the {num_bread_loaves} loaves of bread is ${bread_price_per_loaf} x {num_bread_loaves} = $<<{bread_price_per_loaf}*{num_bread_loaves}={cost_bread}>>{cost_bread}.
Therefore the total amount he will have to pay is ${cost_spam} + ${cost_peanut_butter} + ${cost_bread} = $<<{cost_spam}+{cost_peanut_butter}+{cost_bread}={total_amount_paid}>>{total_amount_paid}.
